intro: Stylogyne martiana, commonly known as the mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Stylogyne martiana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
